name: PROGRESSIVE CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. Blanche M. HOOVER and James E. Hoover, her Husband, Loren J. Druist, Wayne S. Hursh, Marbec Trucking Company, Marvin Sensenig T/D/B/A Marbec Trucking Company and K.B.S., Inc., Appellees

parties: PROGRESSIVE CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. Blanche M. HOOVER and James E. Hoover, her Husband, Loren J. Druist, Wayne S. Hursh, Marbec Trucking Company, Marvin Sensenig T/D/B/A Marbec Trucking Company and K.B.S., Inc., Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 5th day of November, 2001, the Application for Relief to Withdraw as Counsel is granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
786 A.2d 171
PROGRESSIVE CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, Appellant, v. Blanche M. HOOVER and James E. Hoover, her Husband, Loren J. Druist, Wayne S. Hursh, Marbec Trucking Company, Marvin Sensenig T/D/B/A Marbec Trucking Company and K.B.S., Inc., Appellees.
No. 58 WAP 2001.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 5, 2001.
